OHBM 2014


This collection organizes a number of different posters and talks from NISOx and NISOx collaborators at the 2014 Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM) in Hamburg, 8-12 June.

Talks

This section lists OHBM 2014 standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Overview of Meta-Analysis Approaches
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Neuroimaging Meta-Analysis. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484061.v1
  • Advances in thresholding and multiple comparisons
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Advanced fMRI Course. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484058.v1

Posters

This section lists posters submitted to OHBM 2014 by NISOx and NISOx collaborators. Boldface lettering indicates the day of presentation.
  • 1737-T Estimation of Common Community Structures in Multi-Subject Brain Networks Authors: Dragana M. Pavlovic, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484124.v1
  • 1768-M Studying the Effective Brain Connectivity using the Multiregression Dynamic Models Authors: Lilia Costa, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484082.v1
  • 3403-Th Fast Accurate Heritability Screening Using Whole-genome Data Authors: Tian Ge, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484091.v1
  • 3409-Th Fast and Powerful Multiple Testing Inference in Family-Based Heritability Studies Authors: Habib Ganjgahi, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484088.v1
  • 3410-W APACE: Accelerated Permutation Inference for the ACE Model Authors: Xu Chen, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484076.v1
  • 3434-W Classification of Multiple Sclerosis Patients from the Geometry and Texture of White Matter Lesion Authors: Bernd Taschler, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484130.v1
  • 3534-W What is Random Effects Meta-Analysis? Authors: Pantelis Samartsidis and Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484127.v1
  • 3601-Th Permutation Inference for the General Linear Model and the G-statistic Authors: Anderson M. Winkler, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484139.v1
  • 3603-Th The SwE Toolbox: a Toolbox for the Analysis of Longitudinal and Repeated Measures Neuroimaging Data Authors: Bryan Guillaume, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484097.v1
  • 3604-W Multi-level block permutation Authors: Anderson M. Winkler, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484133.v1
  • 3607-Th Simplified power and sample size calculations using prevalence & magnitude of active peaks Authors: Joke Durnez, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484085.v1
  • 3624-W Extending NI-DM to share the results and provenance of a neuroimaging study: an example with SPM Authors: Camille Maumet, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484115.v1
  • 3629-Th Developing and using the Neuroimaging and Data Sharing Data Model: the NIDASH Working Group Authors: David Keator, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484103.v1
  • 3634-W Is Z enough? Impact of Meta-Analysis using only Z/T images in lieu of estimates and standard errors Authors: Camille Maumet, et al. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5484118.v1

This section lists all available OHBM 2014 courses created by or contributed towards by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
